node.description: Pulling and pushing insistently, the bone-chilling currents rush downstream in a frenzied waltz of swirling water. It appears always the same, yet changing constantly, and in the airless world beneath the surface, the river whispers its secret I shall never pass this way again and you will never swim in the same river twice.

node.name: Hunter's Glade, Liirewsag River
node.description: Pulling and pushing insistently, the bone-chilling currents rush downstream in a frenzied waltz of swirling water. It appears always the same, yet changing constantly, and in the airless world beneath the surface, the river whispers its secret I shall never pass this way again and you will never swim in the same river twice.

node.name: Hunter's Glade, Liirewsag River
node.description: A deep carpet of smooth pebbles covers the riverbed, preventing whatever plants might be able to withstand the cold water from finding soil in which to grow. The currents at the river's bottom seem to pull as much down into the earth as downstream.

node.name: Hunter's Glade, Liirewsag River
node.description: A deep carpet of smooth pebbles covers the riverbed, preventing whatever plants might be able to withstand the cold water from finding soil in which to grow. The currents at the river's bottom seem to pull as much down into the earth as downstream.

node.name: Hunter's Glade, Liirewsag River
node.description: A deep carpet of smooth pebbles covers the riverbed, preventing whatever plants might be able to withstand the cold water from finding soil in which to grow. The currents at the river's bottom seem to pull as much down into the earth as downstream.

node.name: Boar Clan, Branches of a Broad Peregan Tree
node.description: Tawny-grey sloped roofs of longhouses huddle below, resembling a gathering of conies in a small woodland clearing. The hum of villagers going about their day is distant here, but the smells of fires, cooking meals, the tannery and tobacco smoke blend richly and hang heavily in the air between each breeze.

Tawny-grey sloped roofs of longhouses huddle beneath the night sky, barely outlined in the darkness by torches placed along pathways. Though there is almost no sound from the village, the smells of fires and pipe smoke flavor the breeze.

node.name: Boar Clan, Branches of a Broad Peregan Tree
node.description: The smell of curing salts is so strong in the branches over the tannery that birds shy from this part of the tree. The squirrels don't seem to mind it, though, and take advantage of the many knotholes in the area to store food and occasionally hide out in.

node.name: Boar Clan, Branches of a Broad Peregan Tree
node.description: A wide expanse of green visible nearby is the village togball field, known for hosting some of the roughest matches in the realms. It is the single greatest pastime of the rugged and independent rangers of Boar Clan.

node.name: Boar Clan, Branches of a Broad Peregan Tree
node.description: Smoke curls from the smoke hole of the Ranger Guildhall below, scented with a variety of woods from spicy cedar to clean-smelling pine. The aroma of cooking meat and turnips mingles with it, filling the air with a welcoming, homey smell. Like the far-ranging villagers that always come back to the guildhall, birds flock to a wooden birdfeeder hanging from the branches nearby.

node.name: Boar Clan, Branches of a Broad Peregan Tree
node.description: Hovering over the sharp points of the palisade wall, those who navigate these branches take extra precaution as the tree sways in the wind. On the other side of the wall, the Hunter's Glade spreads out between the clan village nestled within it and the dark Paasvadh looming just beyond.

node.name: Boar Clan, A Thick Peregan Limb
node.description: Surrounded by a leafy green crown, the thick limb stretches out beyond the village wall into the forested glade surrounding the clan.

node.name: Ranger Guild, Book Nook
node.description: A stone ledge encircling the small cavern holds colorful leather-bound volumes with gilded titles that glint in the lamplight. Thick piles of pelts and high-backed wooden chairs carved with scenes of the hunt offer comfortable seating for readers. A stoneware boar crouches in the center of the room, with curls of pleasantly musky incense smoke curling from its wide grin.

node.name: Ranger Guild, Canteen
node.description: Brass hooks, small shelves, and niches filled with merchandise honeycomb the curved stone wall of the alcove. In the center, neatly stacked crates and baskets surround a tall stool surmounted by an elderly Dwarf, who conducts transactions with a kind, gravelly voice.

node.name: Ranger Guild, Carousel
node.description: The rumblings of carousel machinery hidden behind the stone walls echo through the cavern and calls a beast growling from deep within the earth. The vibrations shake a large oil lamp that hangs from the center of the vaulted ceiling, causing the light to flitter erratically around the room.

node.name: Ranger Guild, Carousel Desk
node.description: A Dwarven clerk slouches behind a heavy oak desk and whittles tiny wooden figures when not attending to patrons. Small heaps of wood shavings litter the floor and fill the cavern with the smell of the forest.

node.name: Ranger Guild, Bank
node.description: A one-legged Gor'Tog bank clerk attends to the needs of patrons at a wooden counter from behind thin steel bars that terminate at the ceiling. Along the counter sit various scales and ledgers and other implements of finance.

node.name: Ranger Guild, Coin Exchange
node.description: Separating the coin exchange from the bank counter is a heavy leather curtain that muffles the sound of transactions that would otherwise echo in the stone chamber. The unmistakable glints of copper, bronze, gold, silver and platinum flash in the dim light.

node.name: Ranger Guild, Small Cavern
node.description: A bathing pool glistens like liquid gold in the light of many lanterns suspended from the ceiling. The soothing sound of water steadily running down the rock face echoes gently, punctuated by the occasional *plop!* in varied, musical tones. Amid blankets and pelts on the floor sits a small table.

node.name: Ranger Guild, A Stony Ledge
node.description: Amid the lanterns hung high above a glistening bathing pool, the stony ledge offers a panoramic view of the cavern hollowed from the earth by the spring water dissolving minerals. Arches, stalagmites and stalactites contribute to an oblique landscape with dramatic curves and folds of stone. A natural rock slide funnels down to the pool below.

node.name: Ranger Guild, Bathing Pool
node.description: Golden shimmers of lamplight ripple across the surface of the pool. Fed from a source below, the warm water swirls softly against the bank of the stony basin with a gentle shushing sound.

node.name: Ranger Guild, Underground Spring
node.description: The turbulent current churns rhythmically with pockets of warmer water constantly bubbling to the surface. Small pebbles whirled with the force of the river become dangerous projectiles, capable of scarring the smooth stone walls as well as soft flesh.

node.name: Ranger Guild, Underground Spring
node.description: Hot spring water bubbles up from cracks in the stone and mingles with the chilly currents of the Liirewsag River flowing in through a narrow crevice. The turbulent water roils and whirls steadily against the smooth rock walls.

node.name: Ranger Guild, Underground Spring
node.description: The water churns rhythmically with pockets of warmer water constantly bubbling to the surface. Flecks of mica in the stone walls glimmer in the lamplight that easily penetrates the crystal clear water.

node.name: Ranger Guild, Hot Spring
node.description: A pale veil of mist hangs at the surface of the bubbling hot spring, washing everything in dreamlike clouds that drift slowly away. On the bank of the pool cling thick pillows of moss, providing a soft cushion against the stone. The sweet smell of jasmine scents the air.

node.name: Ranger Guild, Greenhouse
node.description: A steamy, bubbling pool sits in the center of the glass greenhouse surrounded by feathery ferns. The warm, humid air rises and condenses on everything, fogging the panes of glass and making the leaves of the tropical plants glisten with moisture. Fireflies glow within crystal globes and lend a mellow amber light to the area.

node.name: Ranger Guild, Greenhouse
node.description: A bench swing nestles in a lush green corner filled with temperate plants, including a variety of ivy and roses in a wide array of colors, scents and sizes, from giant golden sun roses and delicate pink Hodierna's blush roses to petite DiSilveron black rosettes. Rare watermist roses surround a small pool into which splashes a waterfall built from piles of riverstone. The rich smells of damp earth underscore the heady, sweet aroma of the flowers.

node.name: Ranger Guild, Greenhouse
node.description: The long glass greenhouse is home to most of the realms' many varieties of plants and flowering shrubs. Nearest the door, open vents keep the environment cooler and drier than further in, where more exotic plant collections are housed. Native flora thrives year-round here and provides valuable specimens for study.

node.name: Ranger Guild, Garden
node.description: A long glass greenhouse sits in the center of a manicured lawn dotted with seasonal flowerbeds and a wide variety of small gardens. Woody shrubs surrounding the clearing create a gentle transition into the tall trees of the forest. Centered in a grassy circle in front of the greenhouse door is a granite sundial with a vine-carved border and a bronze plaque.

node.name: Ranger Guild, Garden
node.description: Dark, velvety patches of night sky peek through the spreading branches of fine native specimen trees. Nestled in the grass below a soaring peregan tree is an ivy-clad garden shed with a rough plank door.

node.name: Hunter's Glade, The Branches of a Felenok Pine Tree
node.description: The strong, aromatic smell of the felenok's needles fills the air and refuses to retreat from the winds that gently rock the tree's thick boughs. Stunning gold-tipped cones that the tree is known for dangle in twos and threes, like arboreal jewels. Truly, the felenok is queen of pines.

node.name: Hunter's Glade, The Branches of a Fat Spruce Tree
node.description: The spruce tree's branches grow in a whorl that spirals up the tree to the sky. Each limb is heavily cloaked in needles and clusters of cones, while a few also support woven birds' nests of different sizes.

node.name: Hunter's Glade, The Branches of a Quaking Aspen Tree
node.description: The papery leaves rustle constantly in the breeze with a sound like falling rain. Ample branches provide plenty of secure places to climb, but shiver in the wind, making the whole tree sway.

node.name: Hunter's Glade, The Branches of a Sikka Tree
node.description: The sap-glazed boughs of the sikka tree glisten almost like glass and glow softly with captured light. Sap drips from the scaly, reddish bark and travels downward until it hardens, embedded with insects, pine needles and other bits. A few thin scars in the bark remain from past harvests of the resin by locals.

node.name: Temple of the North Wind, High Priestess' Sanctum
node.description: Walls of black marble streaked with ice-blue enclose the circular chamber. A heavy armchair upholstered in midnight-blue velvet sits behind an intricately carved ebony desk. Blue silk tassels and fine blue fringe adorn the dark velvet draperies covering most of walls. Heightening the dramatic darkness of the room by way of contrast, a swirling iridescent cloud hovers against one wall like a mist-filled door.

node.name: Temple of the North Wind, Passageway
node.description: Darkness here so intense that it is suffocating, relieved only by tiny clusters of glowing bluish crystals clustered along the route. A swirling iridescent cloud partially juts from a granite wall, its colors bright but producing little light.

node.name: Pilgrimage Trail, The Vela'Tohr Feltery
node.description: This cellar is packed almost to the bursting point with various supplies. Smoked goat and boar hang from the rafters. Crocks of honey and wheels of goat cheese fill the shelves. A path winds between barrels of cornmeal and kegs of salt, ending before a dark tunnel. Necessities like blankets and simple tools, as well as wicker bins filled with potatoes and dried beans, are stacked near the tunnel. Dusty crates provide access to a swirling iridescent cloud in the ceiling.

node.name: Vela'Tohr Edge, In The Black Willow
node.description: Dense boughs blanketed in a lush carpeting of interwoven vines support this perch, high above the Vela'Tohr Woods. In the distance toward the northern edge of the wood, Hag's Crag -- the mountainous home of the Temple of the North Wind -- thrusts into the heavens. Silvery mist veils much of the range, reaching down into the forest like the ethereal fingers of restless spirits.

node.name: Boar Clan, Overgrown Path
node.description: Lurking underfoot, the remains of a gravel path lie below sprawling weeds and uncut grass. A few wooden pikes, their shafts rotting and soft from years of neglect, border the route, still managing to direct pedestrians to and from the field beyond. Wind rustling the leaves in the nearby forest sounds eerily like the breathy cheers of a faraway crowd of enthusiastic togball fans.

node.name: Boar Clan, Overgrown Path
node.description: A tall hedgerow blocks the view of the field to the west of the path. Once neatly maintained, the shrubbery reflects the general sloppiness of the winding, weed-strewn walkway. Discarded like yesterday's newssheet, a torn pennant left near a large wooden pike shifts gently with every footfall upon the unkempt grass.

node.name: Boar Clan, Overgrown Path
node.description: An overturned barrel separates the gravelly route from the large field on the western side. Trash mingles with the grass and bushes as if the group were lifelong friends, inseparable from birth. It's not hard to imagine a bustling throng navigating the path on the busiest of days despite the current state of affairs.

node.name: Boar Clan, Overgrown Path
node.description: Hunched astride a bend in the road, a dilapidated wooden shed creaks and groans with every gust of wind. The curmudgeonly structure looms like an unwanted eavesdropper, interrupting the natural greenery and imposing its dark presence. While its gravel dies near the shack's entrance, the pebbled path resumes its course to the southwest, retreating to the more welcoming grasses.

node.name: Boar Clan, Overgrown Path
node.description: Scraggly branches protrude from the bulky hedgerow to the south like a centipede's legs. The shrubbery crowds the path somewhat, but the tall, flowery grasses along the northern edge balance the scene. A rut divides the rocky path in an uneven line, likely caused by a wheelbarrow's habitual journey.

node.name: Boar Clan, Derelict Togball Field
node.description: Once lush and verdant, the thick grass sprawls unchecked along the ground. The massive hedgerows loom over this corner of the field to create an abundance of shadows for all sorts of creepy crawlies to seek for shelter. Most of the soil is intact here due to the relatively infrequent use during game days, though a giant felled tree creates an imposing dent.

node.name: Boar Clan, Derelict Togball Field
node.description: Trash accumulates upon the ground in staggered clumps, blown onto the grass by errant winds or simply discarded by careless spectators of the past. The corners of a few benches tossed onto the field jut through the tangle of brambles slowly invading the area. Sticky mud underfoot emits immodest sucking sounds as people and creatures traverse the turf.

node.name: Boar Clan, Derelict Togball Field
node.description: Two dilapidated posts lie willy-nilly upon the ground. Once designating the brown side's goal, the rotting shafts serve no more purpose now than to give termites and fungi a place to call home. Debris in the form of jagged branches and decaying leaves restricts passage through the field where there formerly was open space.

node.name: Boar Clan, Derelict Togball Field
node.description: With its roots splayed for all to see, a humongous dead tree prohibits movement in an eastward direction. Insects scurry along the base to scavenge for morsels of detritus or to consume the tender bark. Mold and mushrooms proliferate along the surface, presumably because of the large gaps in the hedgerow that allow outside light to filter in.

node.name: Boar Clan, Derelict Togball Field
node.description: Dense thicket grasses make a play to claim a pair of overturned benches strewn sideways on the ground. Whether the bleachers were ripped from the sidelines by a terrible storm or a pack of rabid fans remains a mystery, though both scenarios are equally as likely. Whatever the reason, the long wooden seats inhibit passage westward, but other trailblazers' footsteps and weapons have cleared the brush in other directions.

node.name: Boar Clan, Derelict Togball Field
node.description: Years of abandonment transformed the field's southeast corner into a marshy swamp. Stagnant liquid refuses to absorb into the water table underground, and since the grassy floor descends slightly, the earth degrades into muck and filth. Splatters of mud cake the surrounding hedgerows as if out of spite.

node.name: Boar Clan, Derelict Togball Field
node.description: Weathered fragments of bone litter one spot in this section of the field. The shards surround a large humanoid skull, likely that of a fallen combatant. Grass grows through the eye sockets and nose holes as fiercely as it flourishes elsewhere in the field.

node.name: Boar Clan, Derelict Togball Field
node.description: Dull paint flakes off the immense benches blocking passage to the east, and vines creep around the wooden legs to ensnare them for all eternity. Dotting the unshapely hedgerows along the southern edge are numerous practice togballs. The dented leather globes protrude from the branches and leaves only a fraction and must have been thrown into the shrubbery with astounding force.

node.name: Boar Clan, Derelict Togball Field
node.description: Tattered and shriveled, what's left of a jersey clings to the pointy branches of the hedgerow. A large ditch plowed into the ground disrupts the field's natural flow, preventing easy travel west. The edges of the long, deep furrow are smooth with slimy moss, indicating the hole is not a recent occurrence.

node.name: Boar Clan, Derelict Togball Field
node.description: Great ruts and gouges in the ground allude to the many midfield battles that took place here in the past. Grass collects in the depressions along with weeds and twigs, though the terrain still threatens to twist the ankles of unobservant wanderers. The formerly pristine landscape now lies in ruins, devoid of its former glory.

node.name: Boar Clan, Derelict Togball Field
node.description: Bumpy logs from a variety of native trees spread across the ground in no particular order. The long, thick chunks of wood rise from the depths of the untamed grass like the backs of alligators in a murky creek. Thankfully, these arboreal additions lack the vicious teeth of the reptiles, though they do manage to trip unwary adventurers and stub quite a few toes.

node.name: Boar Clan, Derelict Togball Field
node.description: Most of the coarse underbrush gives way to less impenetrable grass at this conjunction of sorts. Haphazardly cut, a ragged gash in the hedgerow facilitates access to a gravel path circumnavigating the field. Bits of cloth stick to the rough twigs along the gap's edges, fluttering like confetti against the green backdrop.

node.name: Boar Clan, Derelict Togball Field
node.description: Birds have overrun the towering hedgerow initially set up as the northern barrier. Tawny nests peek out from the foliage, and broken eggshells produce a bright mosaic in the mud below. Wooden posts in various states of destruction rest solemnly upon the tall grass like fallen soldiers on a silent battlefield.

node.name: Boar Clan, Derelict Togball Field
node.description: A broad tree slices through the hedgerow border, likely having crashed onto the field after a lighting strike or other natural calamity. The moldy bark bears deep scratches all along the side, as if some creature was trying to rend the giant trunk in two. Messy patches of earth have been dug up from the ground as well, leaving unsightly bare spots in the grass.

node.name: Boar Clan, Derelict Togball Field
node.description: A collection of sculpted oak creatures sits in a circle around a huge grey boulder. The arrangement is somewhat peculiar considering the environment. Wavy stalks of grass caress the carvings, the growth not impeded by the wooden residents.

node.name: Boar Clan, Derelict Togball Field
node.description: Flying insects swarm above a ditch separating this end of the grounds from midfield. Copious amounts of soggy leaves and smashed twigs obscure the formerly green and manicured lawn underneath. No matter the weather, an eerie chill and a stench of death infect the desolate field.

node.name: Boar Clan, Derelict Togball Field
node.description: Slumped on the ground like bloated corpses, some leather dummies rest amidst the grass and leaves. The practice equipment rots and decays just like everything else exposed to the elements for years on end. A family of enterprising rodents claims sanctuary in one of the torsos, and every now and then, beady eyes glint from the holes riddled through the fabric.

node.name: Boar Clan, Derelict Togball Field
node.description: Splintered oak planks and bent metal rods compose the ruins of a modest structure. A sign hangs from a single nail near the relatively small doorframe. The only inhabitants now are the same weeds and grasses overwhelming the rest of the field.

node.name: Boar Clan, Derelict Togball Field
node.description: Forgotten along with the rest of the clutter, a rusty rake lies adjacent to a tarnished pair of branch cutters. From here, the view of the field through the goal posts reveals how nature is stealing the grounds slowly but surely. Only the few gardening tools, relics of a past time, linger on the field as if to lie in wait for the elements to claim them, too.

node.name: Boar Clan, Derelict Togball Field
node.description: An upended wheelbarrow in the corner explains the excessive amount of dingy white chalk dust encrusted on the hedgerow and grass. Too persistent to be washed away by rain or snow, the mixture must include some type of mortar or cement, likely the brainchild of a lazy landscaper who hated redrawing the lines on the field. Unfortunately, a squirrel met his untimely demise while scampering through the stuff, as he now accents the area as a perfect plaster-cast statue.

node.name: Boar Clan, Derelict Togball Field
node.description: Curiously out of place amongst the lanky weeds, a large metal bathtub is situated directly in front of the green team's goalposts. A film of matte-brown algae thrives upon the surface of the rainwater collected within. The grass does not seem to care, however, as it just keeps growing skyward around the bizarrely placed basin.

node.name: Boar Clan, Overgrown Path
node.description: Shattered and askew beside the road, a rotting oaken plank slowly succumbs to the torture of both time and nature. Deteriorating food scraps and empty bottles abound near a barrel tipped on its side, a gooey sludge leaking from the mouth like regurgitated bile. All signs point to this area formerly housing the field's concession stand, particularly the faded banner labeled 'SNAX' in faint red paint.

node.name: Boar Clan, Weedy Clearing
node.description: Quite literally, this is the end of the road. The gravel fades into rugged brush grasses and spindly saplings, likely taking root in more recent years when constant activity in the area ceased. Surrounded by log fencing, a small patch of land is sectioned off to the west, a crumbling stone well visible through the shafts.

node.name: Boar Clan, Abandoned Utility Shed
node.description: Next to the door, a remarkably intact wooden sign shows a curious but effective stick figure of a large biped wiping its feet on a mat. Two walls are lined with hooks and cubbyholes, where togballers and the grounds crew could store their muddy gear. Tattered bits of once-bright clothing and rotted muddy boots still remain, although the main occupants of the compartments now are a few weasels and a surly raccoon.

node.name: Boar Clan, Abandoned Utility Shed
node.description: Racks along the wall contain implements for the care and upkeep of the field. Rusty rakes, shovels and the like stand at wobbly attention, but a few have fallen out of formation -- especially those where the wooden handles have completely given up the ghost. Some bins in one corner may have held grass seed meant to fill in divots and bare spots on the field after a round of mayhem, although there is no real evidence of this, and they may have actually held turnips or rum for all the observer can tell.

node.name: Boar Clan, Abandoned Utility Shed
node.description: The shattered remains of a door frame along with some badly tilting shelving indicate that this small nook was probably a closet of some sort. Splintered chunks of wood, most of it liberally gnawed, cover the floor. Piled on the shelves and slipped off onto the ground nearby, shreds of jerseys lie as if they were still freshly washed and awaiting the next match.

node.name: Boar Clan, Abandoned Utility Shed
node.description: Tattered banners hang from the rafters. On some one can still see the figure of a boar's head others are merely limp shreds of fabric. Little else distinguishes this area other than a fallen length of roof lying atop a fractured skull. The skull appears too small to be an adult Gor'Tog's, but aside from that, there are no clues as to its origin.

node.name: Boar Clan, Abandoned Utility Shed
node.description: A badly decayed woven rush mat covers nearly the entire floor here. This must have been the practice room, where players could try out their moves with only a modest number of broken bones and smashed heads. Lying askew in one corner, a large skull grins as if proud that it remains intact.

node.name: Boar Clan, Abandoned Utility Shed
node.description: Battered wooden crates and barrels are scattered throughout the area, creating a sort of obstacle course to walk through for any but small animals. It seems likely that they once held foodstuffs, but anything that remained has long since decomposed. The occasional chittering and the faint scrape of claws suggest that some critters have indeed made this place home.

node.name: Boar Clan, Abandoned Utility Shed
node.description: A ring of rusted keys still sitting on a peg on the wall hints that this may have been the guard room for Togs posted to watch the togballs penned in the adjacent room. The remains of a table with three collapsed legs and several oversized broken chairs, none of which are still functional, lie in a jumble in the middle of the floor. Indicative of the seriousness with which guard duty was taken, a pair of dented iron tankards completes the decor.

node.name: Boar Clan, Abandoned Utility Shed
node.description: This appears to be the remains of a large pen. Rusted, cross-hatched wire presumably once kept unfortunates assigned to be togballs inside, although given that the balls were frequently smarter than their jailers, it's debatable whether they really stayed inside for very long. A flimsy door swings on one intact hinge, but it is now unnecessary due to wide gaps in the old wire.

node.name: Boar Clan, Abandoned Utility Shed
node.description: The roots of an immense tree have broken through the floor here, bringing with them a host of mosses, lichens and fungi. As a result, the footing is tricky, requiring one to high-step, duck and be wary of slipping. It is not immediately obvious what this room was used for, but whatever the case, nature has surely claimed it back.

node.name: Boar Clan Togball Field, Brown Attack Zone South
node.description: Thick, lush grass provides soft footing for the competitors who stomp through here. An ebony carving of a hedgehog sitting atop a tall pole identifies this portion of the field.

node.name: Boar Clan Togball Field, Behind the Goal Line
node.description: A high, dense hedgerow closes off the eastern and southern edges of this area. The verdant field remains largely pristine in this remote corner the action rarely comes back here unless a particularly spry togball gets loose and attempts a dash for freedom.

node.name: Boar Clan Togball Field, Behind the Goal
node.description: A high, dense hedgerow closes off the eastern edge of this area. To the west are two stout brown posts embedded upright in the ground, forming the goal.

node.name: Boar Clan Togball Field, Behind the Goal Line
node.description: A high, dense hedgerow closes off the eastern and northern edges of this area. The verdant field remains largely pristine in this remote corner the action rarely comes back here unless a particularly spry togball gets loose and attempts a dash for freedom.

node.name: Boar Clan Togball Field, Brown Blood Zone
node.description: The grass has been beaten nearly flat here, a testament to the rugged play that typically ensues when the ball is close to the goal. Two stout brown posts are embedded upright in the ground to the east, forming the goal. A redwood carving of a hedgehog sitting atop a tall pole identifies this section of the field.

node.name: Boar Clan Togball Field, Brown Attack Zone North
node.description: Thick, lush grass provides soft footing for the competitors who stomp through here. To the north, a high, dense hedgerow prevents any reluctant togballs from making a break for it. A white ash carving of a hedgehog sitting atop a tall pole identifies this portion of the field.

node.name: Boar Clan Togball Field, Brown Half-Forward North
node.description: Thick, lush grass provides soft footing for the competitors who stomp through here. To the north, a high, dense hedgerow prevents any reluctant togballs from making a break for it. A white ash carving of a stag sitting atop a tall pole identifies this portion of the field.

node.name: Boar Clan Togball Field, Brown Half-Forward Center
node.description: A wide, shallow furrow runs east-west through the otherwise thick grass, where over the years numerous competitors have stormed through, dragging the ball behind them. A redwood carving of a stag sitting atop a tall poll identifies this section of the field.

node.name: Boar Clan Togball Field, Brown Half-Forward South
node.description: Thick, lush grass provides soft footing for the competitors who stomp through here. An ebony carving of a stag sitting atop a tall pole identifies this portion of the field.

node.name: Boar Clan Togball Field, Midfield South
node.description: Thick, lush grass provides soft footing for the competitors who stomp through here. An ebony carving of a bear sitting atop a tall pole identifies this portion of the field.

node.name: Boar Clan Togball Field, Midfield
node.description: Although mostly grown over with the thick local grass, the ruts and depressions still give this spot the appearance of the site of a minor explosion. Hotly contested face-offs have resulted in innumerable large bodies skidding off in all directions. A redwood carving of a bear signifies that this is Midfield.

node.name: Boar Clan Togball Field, Midfield North
node.description: Thick, lush grass provides soft footing for the competitors who stomp through here. To the north, a high, dense hedgerow prevents any reluctant togballs from making a break for it. A white ash carving of a bear sitting atop a tall pole identifies this portion of the field.

node.name: Boar Clan Togball Field, Green Half-Forward North
node.description: Thick, lush grass provides soft footing for the competitors who stomp through here. To the north, a high, dense hedgerow prevents any reluctant togballs from making a break for it. A white ash carving of an owl sitting atop a tall pole identifies this portion of the field.

node.name: Boar Clan Togball Field, Green Half-Forward Center
node.description: A wide, shallow furrow runs east-west through the otherwise thick grass, where over the years numerous competitors have stormed through, dragging the ball behind them. A redwood carving of an owl sitting atop a tall poll identifies this section of the field.

node.name: Boar Clan Togball Field, Green Half-Forward South
node.description: Thick, lush grass provides soft footing for the competitors who stomp through here. An ebony carving of an owl sitting atop a tall pole identifies this portion of the field.

node.name: Boar Clan Togball Field, Green Attack Zone South
node.description: Thick, lush grass provides soft footing for the competitors who stomp through here. An ebony carving of a squirrel sitting atop a tall pole identifies this portion of the field.

node.name: Boar Clan Togball Field, Green Blood Zone
node.description: The grass has been beaten nearly flat here, a testament to the rugged play that typically ensues when the ball is close to the goal. Two stout green posts are embedded upright in the ground to the west, forming the goal. A redwood carving of a squirrel sitting atop a tall pole identifies this section of the field.

node.name: Boar Clan Togball Field, Green Attack Zone North
node.description: Thick, lush grass provides soft footing for the competitors who stomp through here. To the north, a high, dense hedgerow prevents any reluctant togballs from making a break for it. A white ash carving of a squirrel sitting atop a tall pole identifies this portion of the field.

node.name: Boar Clan Togball Field, Behind the Goal Line
node.description: A high, dense hedgerow closes off the western and northern edges of this area. The verdant field remains largely pristine in this remote corner the action rarely comes back here unless a particularly spry togball gets loose and attempts a dash for freedom.

node.name: Boar Clan Togball Field, Behind the Goal
node.description: A high, dense hedgerow closes off the western edge of this area. To the east are two stout green posts embedded upright in the ground, forming the goal.

node.name: Boar Clan Togball Field, Behind the Goal Line
node.description: A high, dense hedgerow closes off the western and southern edges of this area. The verdant field remains largely pristine in this remote corner the action rarely comes back here unless a particularly spry togball gets loose and attempts a dash for freedom.

node.name: Boar Clan, Spoiled Well
node.description: Shoots of brown grass tickle the sides of a grey stone well situated inside a partitioned yard. The wooden support from over top the structure has collapsed to one side and now lies covered in soil and weeds. Nowhere to be seen, the well's bucket must have been rescued for a better life elsewhere.

node.name: Boar Clan, Around the Watering Hole
node.description: Grass springs up around the wooden slats fencing in the area. A few tree stumps, their bodies withered and moldy, disfigure the ground in one corner. By the looks of things, they once were used as makeshift seating, and one has a cup-sized hole carved into the top.

node.name: Boar Clan, Around the Watering Hole
node.description: At first glance, the corner fence seems to have received a whitewash in order to improve and preserve the appearance. However, closer inspection reveals layer upon layer of caked-on bird droppings. The nearby hedgerow to the south shakes with activity, likely from the very avian miscreants responsible for decorating the planks.

node.name: Boar Clan, Around the Watering Hole
node.description: Muddy puddles quiver in the ground, their surfaces rippling from time to time due to heavy breezes or footfalls. Impressions in the soft soil take the shape of animal tracks, though some are distinctly humanoid. The grass attempts to prevail despite the injuries from boots and hooves.

node.name: Boar Clan, Around the Watering Hole
node.description: Clumps of grass grow wild around the base of the fence. Though this area was never fully landscaped in its prime, the will of nature has certainly taken charge nowadays. Bleached by the sun and ravaged by inclement weather, the wooden beams enclosing the space survive despite the odds.

node.name: Boar Clan, Around the Watering Hole
node.description: Huddled in the corner, a simple shack tilts slightly to its right, as if using the fence for support. A tiny moon carved out of the waterlogged wooden door declares this as the field's outhouse, though the repugnant stench and residual brown muck seeping from the bottom are both key pieces of evidence for that conclusion. Crude markings on the fence's railings illustrate the boredom and impatience of those forced to wait in line to use the facility.

node.name: Forest, Amongst the Trees
node.description: Periodic sounds of rustling branches and snapping twigs issue forth from deep within the trees, far out of sight in the darkness that pervades this area. The air holds itself thickly still, a bated breath that never seems to be exhaled.

node.name: Forest, Amongst the Trees
node.description: The surrounding darkness is nigh impenetrable as the overhanging branches all but blot out the sky above. Gusts of somehow still stagnant-seeming wind rustle the surrounding foliage, causing it to whip about wildly.

node.name: Forest, Break in the Trees
node.description: The surrounding woods cast deep shadows over the sparse smattering of acanth and elmod tress that dot this small clearing. Dark shapes move between the wildly overgrown plants that have taken up residence within the gaps, some obviously woodland creatures going about their nocturnal routines, while others seem so distorted that identification is all but impossible in the brief moments of their visibility.

node.name: Cabin, Entrance
node.description: Worn to a smooth finish, plain ash flooring mirrors the planks used in both the walls and the ceiling. Little embellishment is present in this small entryway, but the open floor plan allows for glimpses of a sitting area to the north, and the kitchen to the west.

node.name: Cabin, Kitchen
node.description: Sparse and utilitarian, this small kitchen might seem cozy if it had been decorated at all. Instead, the granite countertop and simple pine chair seem almost unused, giving the room a clinical appearance that is only slightly marred by sooty smudges on the wood burning stove.

node.name: Cabin, Sitting Room
node.description: Though smelling faintly of must, this room is nonetheless rather inviting. The floor here is mostly covered by a large earth-toned rug, while the walls have been hung with thick tapestries depicting woodland scenes. Positioned around a circular table, a plush leather sofa is flanked by deep-green upholstered chairs.

node.name: Cabin, Upstairs Hall
node.description: Goldenrod and ochre tones saturate the carpet lining this narrow space, and a subtle scent of aged parchment fills the air.

node.name: Cabin, Library
node.description: More a storage space than a comfortable place to read, this room bears no furniture whatsoever outside of the heavy oaken shelves that line its walls. Crates are arranged in neat rows along the floor, while a stack of stone tablets sits in one corner. Much stronger than in the hallway to the east, the scent of aging parchment pervades the area, now mingled with more obscure, earthy undertones.

node.name: Xerasyth's Office
node.description: With a rough-hewn stone hearth and unadorned wooden walls, this office seems more functional than homey. The simple cherrywood desk is bare save for a mug of tea, and the low side table next to it holds only a single book. Darkness seems to seep into the room from the large picture window behind the desk, vying with the flickering light from bronze lanterns hanging above it.

node.name: Vela'Tohr Edge, Secluded Grove
node.description: Quiet permeates this small glade, punctuated occasionally by sounds from the creatures of the night. Lichen growing along the branches and tree trunks cause the area to glow with a faint green light.
The sense of darkness that permeates the surrounding woods seems to be lifted here. Birds and other small creatures can be heard through the underbrush as well as rustlings of other origins.

node.name: Beard Envy, Sales
node.description: Full-length mirrors appear along the walls, making the area seem much bigger than it actually is. Shelving set up between each of the mirrors displays several busts wearing elaborate faux beards. Busy clerks wander about the area, straightening up displays and restocking supplies.

node.name: Togs for Togs, Garb
node.description: A fine array of clothing hung on racks and hooks surrounds the area, appearing to be separated by sizes. Along the eastern wall, brightly colored signs denote a Gor'Tog section, and the opposing wall hosts a simple sign that seems to be marked with a great deal of scribbles and small stick figures.

node.name: Togs for Togs, Games
node.description: This part of the tent is set up much like a play area, featuring a wide space to allow patrons to challenge each other and pick over a few sport-related goods. A nearby cart laden with food and drinks provides refreshment and a subtle encouragement to boisterous activities.

node.name: Togs for Togs, Grub
node.description: From behind a large counter with a glass display full of meats, the sizzling sounds of a skillet can be heard. A series of tables in the area are laden with various baked and cooked goods, their scents wafting through the air of the tall tent.

node.name: Togs for Togs, Goods
node.description: Cleanly swept, the area on this side of the tent appears very orderly and well put together. Arranged to produce maximum space for browsing customers, several surfaces display a myriad of wares for sale.

node.name: Jakuv's All-Trades Outlet, West Wing
node.description: The western recesses hold cloaks, hats and dresses in various colors and sizes. The shop clerks and minions give helpful opinions on stuff it seems no one despises. Assortments, collections and wares for inspection are laid out in all of their glory, while women and men, their relations and kin, buy additions for their inventory.

node.name: Jakuv's All-Trades Outlet, North Wing
node.description: Collections of cases, batches of backpacks, piles of pouches, and stacks of satchels are appealingly arranged around the area. Several studious stockboys stand silently smiling and survey the surroundings, scanning to see the shoppers' selections and skillfully stocking any shrinking stores with surplus supplies snatched from secreted spots before swiftly scurrying to their specified stations.

node.name: Jakuv's All-Trades Outlet, East Wing
node.description: Uniforms and livery, costumes and attire, ensembles and regalia that every job requires are here awaiting purchase, be it one item or more, sold by clerks with buttons marked By Idon, what a store! Everything a heart desires, anything your job requires, is sold here to the public. Cloaks and tunics! Belts and robes! They haven't missed a trick! Shoppers scurry to and fro and gawk at the selection, pointing out their favorite things with genuine affection.

node.name: Jakuv's All-Trades Outlet, South Wing
node.description: Various boxes, bookcases, and crates are filled with superior stock. Closer inspection, as one might expect, shows nothing that could be called schlock. Baubles and gizmos and geegaws galore! Trinkets and trifles abound! Plainly presented on shelves and on trays so that everything's easily found.

node.name: Twansic's Tent, Main Opening
node.description: Animal pelt walls enclose this tent from the elements while glass globes, hanging from branches above, glow softly with a flickering light. Several Prydaen move about the tent, re-arranging things that have been disturbed. The tent flap gently shifts as people come and go.

node.name: The Wandering Woodsman
node.description: Made of only the best quality hides which have been tanned and oiled to near transparency, the resulting effect is a light and airy, though not especially warm, tent. Several tables, racks and a burlap-padded mannequin are set up in a semicircle along the walls. All of the furniture surrounds a coffee pot that is simmering on a warm brazier set up near the center.

node.name: The Wandering Woodsman, Wardens Quarters
node.description: This portion of the tent is a bit darker with hides of a thicker, heavier variety. Stone tables display some of the larger items beneath the more congruous racks and shelves that line the walls of the modestly-sized interior. A large granite statue of a wolf stands guard at the flap.

node.name: Nahja's Knickknacks, Front Room
node.description: The smell of leather permeates the air within the windowless confines of the long tent walls. The front area features a polished oak table adjacent to a velvet-draped counter. Brightly burning lanterns manage to chase away the shadows and illuminate the merchandise. Mossy green carpet runners lead the way further back into the tent while to the left hangs a dark brown curtain.

node.name: Nahja's Knickknacks, Back Room
node.description: At the back of the tent, all available surfaces have been drafted into use as displays. A makeshift shelf rests above an oak table, each one housing carefully arranged merchandise. Even a rickety pine bench has been put to use with items for sale upon it rather than room for sitting. A russet curtain blocks any attempts at further exploration.

node.name: Smash 'Em, Handle with Care
node.description: The cotton sides are pulled back and tied to the support poles, giving the area an open feeling and allowing any breezes to come through. Along the back of the makeshift room two sturdy wooden pens hold an assortment of togballs while two flanking tables display the cases to hold them. A huge arrow painted bright yellow points the way out.

node.name: Smash 'Em, Something to Wear
node.description: The cotton sides are pulled back and tied to the support poles, giving the area and open feeling and allowing any breezes to come through. Along one side are two racks holding an array of neatly hung jerseys while a pair of shelves sit across from them displaying a collection of togball boots.

node.name: Smash 'Em, Bash 'Em
node.description: The cotton sides are pulled back and tied to the support poles, giving the area and open feeling and allowing any breezes to come through. A pair of large wooden bins sit square in the middle of the room.

node.name: Flight of Hand, Entrance
node.description: The walls of this very high-ceilinged tent are made out of crushed velvet of an off-white color, held up by a massive pole. Occasionally, customers come through, testing out their juggling with varying amounts of success. Numerous pockmarks line the dirt floor, indicating that the area sees quite a bit of foot traffic.

node.name: Flight of Hand, Back of Tent
node.description: Although this corner of the tent is filled with storage, everything is neat and tidy in its proper place. A couple of carpets are laid out on the floor, covered with elegant patterns. Nearby, the single pole holding up the tent's canopy is covered with images of people juggling.

node.name: Flight of Hand, Alcove
node.description: With a lower and more heavily sloped ceiling than the rest of the shop, the off-white velvet making up the tent shimmers slightly in the glow of several gaethzen orbs. Wares are spread out beneath a large image of a golden dragon with its wings unfurled, which is embroidered into the eastern wall.

node.name: The Kindled Spirit
node.description: The interior of this austere tent consists solely of the furnishings necessary to display the merchant's wares. The rich scent of tobacco permeates the area, giving hint to what lies within.

node.name: Goods for Life, Entrance
node.description: A sable cashmere rug stretches across the floor, woven with a depiction of a galloping herd of ivory horses. Warmth and light emanate from a pair of oil lamps flanking a marble statue that stands overbearingly in the center of the entryway. Extravagant lengths of silk drape the walls of the tent, ending in tassels that barely brush the floor.

node.name: Goods for Life, Center Showroom
node.description: Soft splashes and the trickling of water echo from a large fountain dominating the center of the room. Golden Musparan silk draperies hang from the walls, and waves of pale and dark gold adorn the lush carpet, reminiscent of the windswept sands of the Velakan desert.

node.name: Goods for Life, East Showroom
node.description: Beams of light reflect the shimmering diamond tone of swathes of icesilk that adorn the walls of the room, bathing the area in a luminous glow. Quiet rustling and clinking emanate from a young sana'ati tree placed in the center, strips of silk and strings of coins dangling from its branches among the dewy leaves.

node.name: Goods for Life, West Showroom
node.description: Swathes of Elothean lace swoop along the walls of the bright room, soft and airy as clouds against the pale blue wallpaper. A miniature glass ondjai rests at the center of the area upon a large cherrywood table, each room of the partitioned structure home to a different scene.
